snippet: Rising subscription and digital advertising revenue at the company's largest newspapers did not offset the continued drop-off in print advertising, the company reported on Thursday.
abstract: Rising subscription and digital advertising revenue at the company's largest newspapers did not offset the continued drop-off in print advertising, the company reported on Thursday.
lead_paragraph: The New York Times Company reported a 12.2 percent decline in fourth-quarter profit, as rising subscription and digital advertising revenue at its largest newspapers did not offset the continued drop-off in print advertising. Net income was $58.9 million, the company reported on Thursday, compared with $67.1 million in the period a year earlier. For the full year, the company reported a net loss of $39.7 million compared with a profit of $107.7 million in 2010. Read more »

headline.main: Quarterly Profit Falls 12.2% at Times Co.
